newsitem.title: USA: BASEBALL-ROCKIES SLUGGER ANDRES GALARRAGA HAS FRACTURED HAND.
newsitem.headline: BASEBALL-ROCKIES SLUGGER ANDRES GALARRAGA HAS FRACTURED HAND.

text.p: Colorado Rockies slugger Andres Galarraga, who was not in the lineup for Wednesday's 4-0 victory over the winless Chicago Cubs, has been sidelined by a fractured left hand.
Galarraga, who is batting .311 with three homers and 12 RBI in 12 games, suffered the injury in Tuesday's 10-7 victory over the Cubs.
The first baseman fractured the fifth metacarpal of the left hand and will be examined by a hand specialist in Denver on Thursday.
It is not yet known how long the Rockies will have to live without Galarraga's big bat.
The 35-year-old slugger enjoyed a career year in 1996, belting a league-leading 47 home runs and collecting 150 RBI while batting .304. In four seasons with the Rockies, Galarraga has 131 homers.
